result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel James Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel James Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & Jail. eif
signed by Def & Atty. eif
Def's copy of NOH returned from PO; Attempted not known. km
Status conference at 09-21-2015 04:30 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: John M. O'Boyle DF: Samuel James Taylor appeared from jail. Case called at 9:11. Includes 13CF286, 14CF63. ADA Nieskes updates the court. Atty. O'Boyle responds. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to 14CF63. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 14CF63. Court takes judicial notice of 13CF286. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 
6 months St. Croix County Jail
- Court  notes 135 days credit

ADA Nieskes updates the court as to 13CF286 and requests a trial date. Atty. O'Boyle responds.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
From ADA Nieskes to Judge Needham requesting 09-18-15 hearing be reset for a later starting time. Approved by SRN 09-08-15.
Plea hearing at 09-18-2015 09:00 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: John M. O'Boyle DF: Samuel James Taylor appeared. Case called at 1:10.  Includes 13CF286, 14CF63. ADA Nieskes updates the court, on 13CF286 the state is trying to locate individuals. ADA Nieskes requests to have until the end of Aug. for resolution. Atty's have until Sept. 4, 2015 to resolve. Motions in Limine, verdict forms and jury instructions due by Sept. 11, 2015.
filed by Atty O'Boyle. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: John M. O'Boyle DF:  Samuel James Taylor appeared from jail. Case called at 11:47. Includes 14CF63, 13CF286. ADA Nieskes updates the court, he has rec'd a motion to suppress. ADA Nieskes would like to set for a PTC date.  Cut off for agreements is 08-12-2015. Motion hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on July 23, 2015 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on September 18, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle, DF:  Samuel James Taylor appeared from jail. Includes ARGN for 14CF63 and PTC for 13CF286. 
ARGN for 14CF63 - Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Speedy trial is demanded. Discovery within 10 days to Atty O'Boyle - 10 days to file any motions. ADA Nieskes states def is on an interstate detainer. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 11:45 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Apprs: CO: T. Heckmann for SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY: John M. O'Boyle DF: Samuel James Taylor appeared from jail. Case called at 4:36.  Includes 13CF286 STC, 14CF63 Prelim. ADA McKinley requests the Court to take judicial notice of 13CF286. Atty. O'Boyle agrees. S/T Detective G. Willems. Direct by ADA Hahn. Detective Willems identifies the DE in court. Cross by Atty. O'Boyle. ADA McKinley argues. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bond continues in form and amount. Atty's will see JA to schedule arraignment and a PTC.
Appointing Atty O'Boyle. km
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2015 at 04:30 pm.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Samuel James Taylor appeared from jail.  Defendant is in prison in Minnesota.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Bond was previously set with SRN - transfer file to SRN.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif

**BOND AMENDED **
Includes 13CF286,14CF63
Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
DE to report to St. Croix County jail to provide current address every Saturday by 5:00 p.m. commencing 1-11-14. Law enforcement may complete UA testing every Saturday.
DE to Sign waiver of extradition form.
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2015 at 04:30 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: M. Nieskes DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle for today. DF: Samuel James Taylor appeared from jail. Case called at 11:19. Includes 13CF286, 14CF63. ADA updates the court. DE to come in for intake today with Branch 1. ADA Nieskes requests a STC. Court quashes warrants.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
